page.title: 14A FIREMAN'S TYPICAL DAY
page.content: A Firefighter at Burton Fire Station A typical shift would start with a parade, exchange of watches(shifts) and designation of duties.These would include checking appliances for oil, water,lights etc. and that all the equipment is there; drills, which may involve training with pumps, ladders, breathing apparatus, chemical incidents, rescue, simulated road traffic accidents, radiac equipment, etc. Physical training and a lecture period would be included before a break for a meal.There would follow hydrant inspections,risk inspections which give a topographical knowledge of risks in a patch. A plan is drawn of each risk and aspects noted such as access,water supplies, etc. General maintenance of equipment such as cleaning and repair of hoses would need regular attention.
